comment: Professor Ramamoorti was an absolutely amazing professor. I just graduated, and he has easily been the best professor I have ever had. I would take him over and over again if I had the chance.

Dr. Ramamoorti is a wonderful professor.  He is extremely knowledgeable about all things accounting and finance; very entertaining in delivering the material.  He is a more than fair grader.  Make an effort and you will get credit.  One major group project very intimidating at first, but grading was generous.  He is the best!

My favorite professor throughout college. His lectures were really interesting. He's got a million credentials and real world experience. Brings a unique approach to accounting and cares for his students. Learned a lot in class. He gave us two tests, one presentation, and a few smaller assignments throughout the semester. Workload is not bad at all

Spring 2016. Ramamoorti is a very spirited speaker and makes the lectures interesting. He also brings in a few guest speakers who gives first hand accounts of their current business. Ramamoorti has a depth of knowledge and gives real world examples. This is an interesting subject to take as well.

I attended in Spring 2016. Most classes consisted of a lecture and a few guest speakers. The attendance wasn't mandatory but it definitely helped to be there. Ramamoorti is a great speaker and has a plethora of knowledge. He made lectures interesting with his bold voice and occasion jabs of humor. He truly cares about the material and his students.

This is my 2nd semester taking Dr. Sri and I still only have great things to say about him. Not only do you learn a lot, but he is also interesting. I recommend him to anyone who asks what electives to take. With enough effort you can for sure make an A. A majority of the 2 test grades are take home short answer questions which make learning easy.

Dr. Sri is an incredible professor. He is passionate about the subject and his students. If you take the time to come to class and participate, you will be rewarded. He opened many doors for me, and helped me to make a number of incredible connections. There is a good amount of work (projects, papers) but he can help you land a job. Take him!

Dr. Sri's valuation course was enjoyable! He does have a sense of humor. The course comprised of: 2 major essays, a midterm, a final, and a group project. The textbook was used, which helped with the essays and exams. Great professor!

Best class ever, learned a lot about valuation. Did not buy d book and did not need it as he teaches everything in class & got an A. One mid term n one final pretty duable just go over the slides and go to class final has repeated quests from mid term.. One project but gives plenty of time and lots of direction you actually enjoy it! Love him

Prof. Ramamoorti is the best lecturer I had at K S U. He uses real life experience in the corporate world to help make his students understand the course. I did not have to read a lot but showed up at 90% of his lectures and take down notes. Be ready to participate in class and be prepared for group projects as well. Great Professor!

Dr. Sri was a great professor. You do have to work for your grade, but he gives you all of the information that you need to succeed. I would absolutely take any of his classes again. If you have a chance to take any of his classes, definitely do it!!

Dr. Ramamoorti is a good professor who enjoys teaching and is helpful outside of class.  The class was interesting and enabled me to learn about an area that was new to me.  I would have been glad to take another course from him.

Dr. Ramamoorti is very knowledgeable about the material, and he is also willing to help students outside of class.  The subject is interesting, and the course provides an opportunity for students to learn about valuation, a topic which students may not frequently study as accounting majors.

Dr. Ramamoorti gave a lot of real life personal experience from the corporate world and they are very helpful to the material that we study. Dr. Ramamoorti inspired us to have integrity being an accountant. Dr. Rmamoorti is very funny as well.

Dr. Ramamoorti gave a lot of real life personal experience from the cooperate world and they are very helpful to the material that we study. Dr. Ramamoorti inspired us to have integrity being an accountant. Dr. Rmamoorti is very funny as well.

Buy the book, you will use it.  He is well connected and a nice guy.  You have group presentations as well as papers.  We were assigned about 30 pages of writing the last two weeks of class between essay questions and two papers (my only gripe about this class).  Otherwise, show up to class, listen, take notes.  He does talk about himself history.

Business Valuation with Dr. Ramamoorti was one of the most interesting classes I've taken at KSU. Not only did we get to see a different side of accounting, but we got to hear from guests who were in the valuation field. This class definitely shows you an interesting side of accounting and finance, and gives insight into a potential career field.

Dr. Sri is a wise, helpful and kind professor at KSU. He is willing to help you if you face difficulties in life, school and work. He has great connections and everyone knows him. Read his book "ABC Behavioral Forensic" then you can easily be on track of "Forensic Accounting" class. He is also a great mentor. So, go to talk to him. Great professor.

Dr. Ramamoorti was enthusiastic about teaching this course and extremely knowledgeable about accounting and related matters. He was occasionally unclear about what materials we were required to cover, and a few times we even performed homework on subjects we had not covered, but the effort required to do well in the class was appropriate enough.

Not the best teacher or the worst. Easy grader. You learn more doing the class project than from the lectures. He spends most of those talking about his glory days when he used to know important people. Class is an easy A, but take someone else if you want to learn instead of spending the semester pretending to be interested in this guy's bs.

He has difficulty staying on topic because he takes every opportunity to point out how brilliant, well-read and cultured he is and that he knows a lot of important people. He wastes so much class time with self-aggrandizement. Obnoxious.

Wonderful professor, very funny. His class requires some work, there is a group project, but he helps you prepare for it and doesn't expect perfection. The book is expensive, but it was used. It might be good to take with a friend, so you can share the book. Earning an A is likely as long as you put in the work.
One of the best instructors I have ever see, he is more concerned about the practicalities of the accounting rather than the theory, he is very helpful, humble and nice.
Good Professor. Co-Author of the book we used and very knowledgeable about all topics. Very connected in the professional world. TAKE HIM.
Awesome class. I highly recommend you take this professor if possible. His lectures are on topic, and he knows many people in the business world.
